intro: Malleola brevisaccata, commonly known as the short-sac malleola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, tubular flowers are often pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
